title: Understanding Attachment Theory
text: Attachment theory is a psychological model that helps explain the dynamics of long-term interpersonal relationships between humans. It focuses on the bond between infants and their primary caregivers.

title: Key Components of Attachment Theory
text: Attachment theory suggests that the quality of the early bond between a child and their caregiver can influence the child's emotional and social development throughout their life.

hintAnswer: a psychological model that explains how early interactions between infants and their caregivers can shape the development of social and emotional functioning across the lifespan
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes attachment theory?
choices: a mental health condition that can develop after experiencing or witnessing a terrifying event
intrusive thoughts or memories of the trauma, avoidance of trauma reminders, negative changes in mood or thinking, and hyperarousal or reactivity
a group of psychiatric conditions resulting from a disruption in the normal attachment process between a child and a caregiver
a psychological model that explains how early interactions between infants and their caregivers can shape the development of social and emotional functioning across the lifespan
